author: henning
msg: The real reason why some of the reports e.g. jdepend end up in wrong
directories:
It goes like this:
- Maven has a plugin called "xdoc". This defines a taglib called "doc"
and a specific tag called "doc:jsl". This does a check to define
where the output of a JSL transformation should go by looking at a
parameter called "outputDirectory". This ends up in a jelly variable
called ${outputDirectory}. If it is empty, then we use the maven.gen.docs
property, which normally points at target/generated-xdocs
- We use the Torque plugin. This defines a few ant tasks, some of them
take a parameter called "outputDirectory"...
- We use preGoals to build our OM sources. This happens to be run before the
e.g. jdepend jsl task. By running the torque plugin, it calls one of the
ant tasks like this:
<torque-data-model
outputDirectory="${torque.java.dir}"
- And now Jelly, Maven or whatever LET THAT DEFINITION of
outputDirectory LEAK INTO A GLOBAL VARIABLE NAME SPACE! HORRORS! WHO
EVER DREAMED OF THAT? DID YOU WATCH TOO MANY BAD MOVIES? WHAT IS
THIS? VISUAL BASIC?
- Now the tag check for outputDirectory is no longer empty. So the
report file ends up in ${torque.java.dir} and not in ${maven.gen.docs}
It took me the better part of an afternoon to find _that_ stupid
bug. Now I go and get drunk.
